hypothesis_content.title: CPI Surprise Amplification with VIX Decay
hypothesis_content.statement: When CPI surprises (positive or negative) exceed 0.3% vs consensus during NEUTRAL regimes, the initial 2-hour price move will be amplified by 1.5-2x in the following 24 hours as institutional flows catch up to retail reaction, with VIX term structure providing directional confirmation.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Institutional reaction to macro data lags retail by 2-6 hours as risk committees meet and allocate. During NEUTRAL regimes, positioning is less extreme, allowing cleaner amplification. VIX term structure confirms whether the surprise is perceived as regime-changing.
entry_conditions: CPI release surprise magnitude > |0.3%| vs consensus
BTC 2-hour post-release move > |1.5%| in surprise direction
VIX futures term structure (M2/M1) confirms direction (contango for positive surprise, backwardation for negative)

exit_conditions.take_profit: 24 hours post-entry OR price reaches 1.8x initial 2-hour move

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of qualifying events show price mean-reverting within 12 hours instead of amplifying, or VIX term structure fails as directional filter (accuracy < 55%).
